short_description: Experience the pristine wilderness of Antarctica, the world's southernmost continent. Discover breathtaking ice landscapes, unique wildlife including penguins and seals, scientific research stations, and the awe-inspiring beauty of the last great frontier on Earth.

health.tap_water_safety: Water is typically sourced from melted ice and treated at research stations
alcohol_info: Alcohol regulations depend on the nationality and policies of each research station
Most research stations have strict alcohol policies due to the extreme environment

tipping.guides: Tipping practices vary by tour operator and expedition company
tipping.restaurants: N/A - Limited dining facilities at research stations

weather.title: Antarctica has an extreme polar climate with the coldest temperatures on Earth. The continent experiences long, dark winters and short, cool summers. Weather conditions are harsh and unpredictable, with strong winds and extreme cold.

when_to_visit.title: Antarctic Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: The only time when tourist visits are possible. Warmer temperatures (still below freezing), 24-hour daylight, and accessible conditions. Best time for wildlife viewing, especially penguins and seals. Cruise ships operate during this period

when_to_visit.title: Antarctic Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Extremely cold with 24-hour darkness. Only accessible to scientific researchers at permanent stations. Not suitable for tourism due to extreme conditions and inaccessibility

when_to_visit.title: Wildlife Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Peak wildlife activity with penguin colonies active, seals on beaches, and whales in surrounding waters. Best time for wildlife photography and observation. Warmer temperatures and longer daylight hours

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Antarctica is during the Antarctic summer from November to March, when conditions are most accessible for tourism, wildlife is most active, and cruise ships operate expeditions to the continent

emergency.title: Search and Rescue
emergency.number: Contact expedition operator or nearest research station

emergency.title: Medical Emergency
emergency.number: Contact expedition medical team or research station
